title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer to practice at second and third base as Red Sox spring training begins.
Manager Alex Cora aims to finalize Boston's infield positions before 2026 regular season starts.
The Red Sox focus on reducing errors after leading MLB in errors for the past three years.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant decides not to interview for OC roles, staying with New England for the 2026-27 season.
Grant, from Manchester, Conn., was key in QB Drake Maye's development, leading the Patriots to Super Bowl LX.
Grant is a former Assumption University wide receiver, beginning his coaching career at Holy Cross in 2019.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Brighton community raised over $25,000 through GoFundMe for Matt's Barber Shop after it suffered flooding on Feb. 10.
The flood at 408 Market St., caused by a burst pipe, severely damaged the shop's interior and equipment.
Dietrich Warner, a regular customer, initiated the fundraiser, showcasing strong community support for local businesses.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Apple TV's 'Eternity' stars Elizabeth Olsen and Miles Teller in a fantastical romcom exploring relationships in the afterlife.
'Harold and Maude,' starring Bud Cort and Ruth Gordon, is now available for streaming on Pluto TV.
Netflix's hit reality show 'Love Is Blind' returns with Season 10, exploring unconventional relationship dynamics.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge ruled books on gender stereotypes are not part of a legal battle over LGBTQ lessons in Lexington, Mass.
The lawsuit by a parent, Alan L., focuses on issues of gender identity, sexuality, and gay rights, excluding gender stereotypes.
Judge Saylor determined materials like 'Pink Is For Boys' do not infringe the plaintiff's religious beliefs on gender identity.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony, 21, to join Team USA for the World Baseball Classic pending a physical exam.
Anthony replaces injured outfielder Corbin Carroll of the Diamondbacks, being the youngest on the Team USA roster.
Anthony hit .292 with eight home runs in 71 MLB games and aims to play alongside stars like Aaron Judge.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: A penthouse at the Ocean House in Westerly, Rhode Island, is on sale for $20 million.
The penthouse features 4,696 square feet, three bedrooms, four bathrooms, and overlooks Block Island Sound.
Ownership includes access to luxury amenities, including a private beach and Ocean House Club membership.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics are 35-19, sitting second in the Eastern Conference entering the All-Star break.
Boston ranks third in offensive rating and second in defensive rating, showing elite two-way play.
Celtics have a 12-14 record in clutch games, ranking 21st in the league for this stat.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers diverse winter activities, including museums, beaches, and trails, with fewer crowds compared to summer.
Visitors can enjoy art and history museums, such as Sandwich Glass Museum and JFK Hyannis Museum, in various towns.
Dining options range from locally-owned restaurants and bakeries to breweries and the unique UVA Wine Bar in Mashpee.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Type 1 Diabetes research through Breakthrough T1D.
A former Boston resident and pharmacist, Lapczynski has lived with Type 1 Diabetes for 23 years.
Her participation also honors her mother, recently diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes, and her work with diabetic patients.
